Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to back up the existence of a new, rare tick burrowing under the skin.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes the existence of a new tick without providing any substantial evidence or scientific backing.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the post was created as an experiment by Mychael Gallagher and is not based on real information.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the potential threat of a new tick burrowing under the skin by presenting it as a genuine warning.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any aspect.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide alternative explanations or consider other possibilities.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting false information and using unrelated photographs to mislead the audience.
